3
Gen. Buckner to Federal Agent Mellen
Headquarters Ky. State Guard,
Louisville, June 25, 1861.
SPECIAL ORDER,
No.
Sir

I understand that the Collector of the Port of Louisville has represented that you are the general agent of the U. S. Government at this port, exercising a supervisory control over all shipments by water from Louisville, I further understand that the application of the Quartermaster of the State troops, for a permit to ship necessary Equipments for the State forces at Columbus, Ky., you refused your sanction, even after the Collector fo the port had given his.

Am I to understand from this, that you claim the right ot prevent the State of Kentucky from Exercising the clear right of furnishing her ow Militia with what is necessary for their Equipment, and that you assume, as an agent of the U. S. Government, to supervise and veto the official acts of the constituted authorities of Kentucky, acting in accordance with Existing laws?

I am Sir,
Very respectfully
Your ob't Servt
(Signed) S. B, Buckner
Insp. Gen. of Ky
